txt.en: Talk to Fastrith Hawkfeast in Zul-mazal
'It is a shame that the passage of the years has ruined such a work of art!'
'You speak truth! They delight in it!'
'So many stones are missing. Villains must have taken them away.'
'What do you think the mosaic depicted when it was made?'
Bored by the discussion, Imák has called for you to speak with him. He believes danger is near.
'I think this mosaic was damaged by more than just time, cousin.'
'This mosaic must have been quite lovely, once! I have only been apprenticed to Stáli the Hewer for a short time, but I am certain he will want to see this!'
'Orcs revel in the destruction of beauty.'
Bori has suggested that you bring Fastrith to inspect the broken mosaic in Zul-mazal in order to see if her master Stáli the Hewer would be interested in it.
'It stands now in the workshop of Stáli the Hewer! He was seeking to restore it.'
A hobgoblin prey-catcher has found the entrance to Zul-mazal, and before he was slain he alerted his band to your position. You and the dwarves must ready your defence!
'I saw it there once when I visited my brother Eskil.'
Bori and the other dwarves prepare to defend Zul-mazal from the hobgoblin hunting-pack.
'Cousin, do you remember when our fathers assembled the Iron Garrison at Erebor?'
'Something smells foul, [placeholder]. Let them study that mosaic... we should look around for the source of this unsettling odour.\n\n'I think danger is near.'
'A mosaic stood in the Hall Under the Mountain.'
'You go ahead. I care not for Longbeard art.'
'That mosaic must have been a copy of this one!'
'These hobgoblins do not know who they have chosen for dancing partners!\n\n'Let us show them the mistake they have made!'
Imák calls for you from the other side of the chamber
'There could be more. Do not relax your guard!'
You and the dwarves have defended Zul-mazal from the hobgoblin hunting-party.
'There will be more of them. Let's return to the others and prepare!'
Protect Imák as he looks for the danger he has sensed
Remain alert for any further threats to the dwarves
'That was well-fought, [placeholder]. Perhaps these Longbeards can take care of themselves after all... so long as there is a Stout-axe nearby to lend a hand!'
Fastrith and the other dwarves stand in Zul-mazal, discussing the broken mosaic on the wall.
'That was well-fought, [placeholder]. Perhaps you Longbeards can take care of yourselves after all... so long as there is a Stout-axe nearby to lend a hand!'
'That was well-fought, [placeholder]. Perhaps these Longbeards can take care of themselves after all... so long as there are Stout-axes nearby to lend a hand!'
Fight alongside the dwarves in defence of Zul-mazal. <rgb=#FF0000>The dwarves must not be defeated!</rgb>
'I remember there WAS a mosaic, but that's all.'
'You are more likely to find the lost Zabad'ibîn, I think.'
'He delivers judgement to Mótsog the Traitor.'
Listen to the dwarves discuss the broken mosaic in Zul-mazal
'If we were to find the stolen stones that made up the mosaic...'
'Perhaps we will find both! Bróin will help me!'
'That is a pity! I was just getting warmed up!'
'But now I can better examine the mosaic, so I suppose that is for the best.'
Return to Zul-mazal with Imák and ready the defence
'We will restore the mosaic in this chamber, hobgoblins or no hobgoblins!'
